intro: Stipa eminens f. viridis, commonly known as the green-stemmed feathergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a variant of Stipa eminens, characterized by its slender, greenish stems that distinguish it from the typical silver-green stems of the species. The plant produces fluffy, pale yellow to brownish spikelets that are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or rocky areas. This ornamental grass is valued for its fine texture and delicate appearance, making it a popular choice in landscaping and garden design.
